title: Fixing this issue: https://github.com/CivicActions/nebula/issues/82
Drug name is not being cleared post Compare
body:
Clear the drug field when the user clicks the Compare button.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12954654/8439373/a6d9624c-1f39-11e5-8465-502c6a93d86e.png)

title: Responsive page layout is off
body:
The site doesn't appear truly responsive. The charts don't fit into the browser window properly and are cut off or using too little space. The page headings are not responsive and are being truncated. 

On the iPhone the site doesn't fill the browser:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12954654/8439182/460b201e-1f38-11e5-93de-5936be4cb01b.png)


The pie chart should float left so it can be seen in the window and not get cut off:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12954654/8439177/4107417e-1f38-11e5-8ab6-fd13e7be770f.png)

title: Bar chart doesn't fill page on iPhone
body:
The bar chart is only using half the space available. Can it span the width of the mobile browser window?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12954654/8439114/cac778d0-1f37-11e5-8249-fcc324151738.png)

title: Keep drug legend fixed at top of page as it scrolls
body:
As a user I want to see the legend of drug colors even as I scroll down the page so that I can know which colors on the bar chart match each drug. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12954654/8438151/16d8bbd6-1f32-11e5-9243-b08a031201f4.png)

title: On click remove placeholder drug name in field
body:
When the user clicks into the drug name field remove the example drug "TYLENOL" (don't wait until the user starts to type; it should disappear 'on focus').
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12954654/8435593/26220a78-1f20-11e5-82b3-00e3bb282bd8.png)

title: Push each drug to Google Analytics as it is added to the tool
body:
We configured Google Analytics to use Site Search to record the most popular saved searches.  For example  http://sideeffect.local/?saved=FINASTERIDE+FUROSEMIDE is recorded as a search for "Finasteride furosemide".  

This only records people who access that comparison via a shared URL.  

In order to capture each drug individually as a search event, we want to push  http://sideeffect.local/?saved=FINASTERIDE and http://sideeffect.local/?saved=FUROSEMIDE as each of those drugs gets added to the tool.

title: Change title of Bar Graph to: Total Reported Adverse Events
Handle the fact that AHRQ doesn't contain drug in some elegant manner.
body: Tyson made it very clear that he wanted to see whatever information was in Adverse Events, whether in AHRQ or not.

title: Need to point out phone numbers are for the US only.
Header hierarchy
body:
This seems like a fairly low priority accessibility issue (and a fair amount of effort to resolve) - the headers are not bad in that the h3 and h4 cover decent levels of content, however they are don't capture a complete hierarchy. Ideally they should look more this, however:

* h1. SideEffect.io
* h3 headers should be h2s
* There should be a "Sources and disclaimers" or similar h2 header to wrap that information
* All the source/disclaimer h4 headers should then be h3

If we are using HTML5 sections, then the header hierarchy should restart from h1 inside each section.

title: <big> element is depreciated
body: https://validator.w3.org/nu/?doc=http%3A%2F%2Fsideeffect.io%2F

title: Remove duplicates where we are creating HTML Dom objects for checked drugs....
Remove use of SessionStorage
body: We can use a page-scoped variable for this.

title: Change the way we use SessionStorage to not use individual drugs as keys
body: Rather, we should put keys with an array, all of which has a single key.

title: [REFACTORING] Create subroutines for bar chart and pie chart data construction
body: .. in nebular.js.  Input should probably be tempData.

title: Remove chart.js if it is unused
body: I think we switched to Google Charts for stacked bars, so we should remove this (and the line from LICENCE.md)

title: Display legend drug names in consistent case
body:
If I type in a name in lowercase and don't select what's been auto-completed but use my typed drug instead it shows up as I typed it. I'd like to see all drug names consistently displayed. I think the look of all caps as we've been doing. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12954654/8415257/813763fa-1e6b-11e5-979c-6b637571b2ca.png)

title: Someone suggested a heat map...may a "tree map"?
body: I'm not sure what they meant, but we COULD build a TreeMap of adverse events.  It's unclear to me that this would be better, but it is an interesting idea.

title: Charts don't show up on iPad in private browsing or on older Safari versions
In Footer, add "return" before titles (not sure what this means).
Where we link to "report", change it to inform them to "USA FDA....
body: Tomorrow partners point this out.

title: Working on portable URL....
body: Tommorow partners suggests changing name from "Link to this search" to "Share this search" --- seems like a good idea.

title: We are repeating drug names in multiple places....
body: But this needed for check list.  Possibly we can improve design in that part.

title: Still unclear what the pie chart is really displaying....
body: at least according to Tomorrow Partners.  We need to improve the TITLE and maybe do something else.

title: Treat tile of bar chart and Pie chart similarly...
body: From Tomorrow partners....I think this is trickier than it looks.  Let's work with Ron to try to design a solution.

title: [MEDIUM] Our use of the "?search=aspirin" doesn't work....
body: Possibly this is simply ignorance. But we need to make it work, or document it, or something.

title: Change the "saved" URL parameter to "drugs"
body:
These URLs would be more semantic.   

So instead of 
`/?saved=crestor+benicar+niaspan+aspirin` it would be `/?drugs=crestor+benicar+niaspan+aspirin`

If we make this change, we'll also want to adjust the Google Analytics Site Search setting (change from "saved" to "drugs").

title: [LOW] Probably should make the API Key an Environment Variable
body: We don't really want other people using our API Key to access the OpenFDA database---though it doesn't hurt anything in a low-usage situation.  We should probably move this to a configured value so that people copying our code get their own key.

title: Remove the "Side Effects" subtitle
body:
Remove the "Side Effects" heading from blank search and results pages. See updates wires:
[blank search] (https://civicactions.mybalsamiq.com/projects/agile-gsa/PV%20-%20Find%20Drug)

and [results page with new axis descriptor] (https://civicactions.mybalsamiq.com/projects/agile-gsa/PV-%20Drug%20List%20Vertical%20Revised%2006272015)
